In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your problem written in Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end

# Example usage:
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()-Month(i) for i in 1:3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This function takes a `DataFrame` as input and creates a new column `ym` by mapping over each element of the `dt` column, extracting year and month from DateTime, concatenating them together into an integer format "yyyymm", and assigning it to the newly created `ym` column. 

The example usage shows how you can create a sample DataFrame with random dates in the past, apply the function, and print out the resulting DataFrame.
